channel.title: YES! Found a free C++ Compiler!
channel.description:
Download: http://www.bloodshed.net/dev/devcpp.html
Download the 2.4 MB one. That one is a small executable one! PERFECT!
Great for c and c++ beginners. I'm sick of learning html, php, mysql, scar, and delphi. Next one is c++! man I'm taking a break... a week break from coding lol.
~Ron

item.title: YES! Found a free C++ Compiler!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

But a full IDE is helpful.
Don't limit yourself just because you think it makes you a better coder.

Also, if all you need is a blank sheet that compiles, use notepad and the command line version of MINGW GCC (the compiler Dev-C++ uses).

Read full topic
item.source: YES! Found a free C++ Compiler!

item.title: YES! Found a free C++ Compiler!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Yeah but if you know what you're doing and have read some c books, you don't need a full IDE. All you need is a blank sheet that compiles. Simple and efficient.

Read full topic

item.title: YES! Found a free C++ Compiler!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Well I finally found a free one cheesehunk.

Mopman, Pwnd is right. Microsoft adds a lot of extra stuff in there that you don't need. Have you looked at the size of Microsoft's C/C++ compiler and compared it with the 2.4 MB compiler I have linked? THERE IS A HUGE DIFFERENCE.

Read full topic
item.source: YES! Found a free C++ Compiler!

item.title: YES! Found a free C++ Compiler!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Pwnd:

Bloodshed owns Microsoft software. The compiler is much easier to manage, plus Microsoft adds a bunch of bullshit that you don't need.

What do you mean by "easier to manage"?
And what bullshit does MS add that I don't need?

Read full topic
item.source: YES! Found a free C++ Compiler!

item.title: YES! Found a free C++ Compiler!
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Lol, you finally found one?

Open your eyes next time.. I use this one, its great!
I made a couple simple things with it, then gave up.

#include <iostream>
using namespace std;
int main()
{
  int thisisanumber; 
  cout<<"Please Enter a number: ";
  cin>> thisisanumber;
  cin.ignore();
  if (thisisanumber == 3) {
       cout<<"You picked the best number ever!!\n";
  }     
  else if (thisisanumber>0) {
     thisisanumber = thisisanumber* 2;
     cout<<"You entered: "<< thisisanumber <<"\n";
     thisisanumber = thisisanumber/2;
     cout<<"..Just kidding, you entered: "<< thisisanumber <<"\n";
  }
  else if(thisisanumber<0) {
       cout<<"Don't be so Negative!=P\n";
  }     
  else {
       cout<<"You have to be joking, who enters 0 as a number";
  }
  cin.get();
}

First script...

Read full topic
